pullRequest.body:
This PR includes some equalities and equivalences about expressions with natural numbers.

They can be useful as rewriting lemmas to simplify expressions.

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [080b686f83](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23100/commits/080b686f83d7b3db9a8bd20fb673de241c2c40bf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ div_le_iff_le_mul_of_dvd`
`+ div_mul_right_comm`
`+ eq_div_iff_mul_eq_left`
`+ lt_div_iff_mul_lt_of_dvd`
`+ mul_add_mul_div_of_dvd`
`+ mul_div_right_comm`
`+ mul_sub_div_of_dvd`
`+ mul_sub_mul_div_of_dvd`
`+ sub_mul_div'`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thank you for the PR!
Can you please use `x \ne 0` instead of `0 < x` in the assumptions?

Do you know about `Nat.sub_mul_div`? It looks a better version of your lemma (because it doesn't require divisibility), except that instead it needs `n * k ≤ m`, which you should be able to get away with.

In short, can you do
```suggestion
/-- TODO: Replace `Nat.sub_mul_div` in core. -/
lemma sub_mul_div' (x n p : Nat) : (x - n * p) / n = x / n - p := by
```
? Can you then perform the analogous changes for the other lemmas you're adding below?

Thank you for the hint.

What do you mean by getting away with `n * k  ≤ m`? to use it as a hypothesis instead of the positivity and divisibility ones?

Another question: by doing the analogous changes you mean in the names of the theorems?

Sorry, I mean that you should need neither divisibility nor `n * k ≤ m`.

By the analogous changes, I mean
1. Renaming the theorems
2. Renaming the variables
3. Turning the iff around
4. Remove the divisibility conditions

I just pushed a commit with some of the suggested changes. I couldn't find more hypothesis to drop (nor relax, although I am not 100% sure about the existence of a possible weakening).

There exist some other theorems that give equivalences under weaker assumptions in the same spirit, but they produce more complicated formulae; so I think it is worth having these more concrete formulae for the cases where the divisions are exact.
To add some context: the motivation for this PR comes from #8102 , where I try to implement a tactic that manipulates expressions in the same way that one would do naively by hand.

Arguments should be explicit unless mentioned in later arguments, since it's a rewriting lemma:
```suggestion
lemma sub_mul_div' (a b c : ℕ) : (a - b * c) / b = a / b - c := by
```
Added explicit variables in the lemmas where not all of them are mentioned in the hypothesis.

Prefer `d ≠ 0` over `0 < d`
```suggestion
lemma mul_add_mul_div_of_dvd (hb : b ≠ 0) (hd : d ≠ 0) (h1 : b ∣ a) (h2 : d ∣ c) :
```

If you do the correct casesplit, then there's no need to fiddle around with the hypotheses
```suggestion
  obtain h | h := le_total (b * c) a
  · rw [Nat.sub_mul_div _ _ _ h]
  · rw [ Nat.sub_eq_zero_of_le h, Nat.zero_div]
```
Thanks. Done.

Can you make sure your code is properly formatted? There are currently plenty of issues with it, eg:
```suggestion
  obtain ⟨n, hn⟩ := h1
  obtain ⟨_, hm⟩ := h2
  rw [hn, hm, Nat.mul_assoc b n d, Nat.mul_comm n d, ← Nat.mul_assoc, ← Nat.mul_assoc,
```
I added the corresponding spaces after commas.

`b` and `c` can be inferred from later arguments. `a` cannot, but can instead be inferred from the LHS or RHS, so put it last. Also it's nicer if you use meaningful hypothesis names, if only to help your reader
```suggestion
lemma mul_sub_div_of_dvd (hc : c ≠ 0) (hcb : c ∣ b) (a : ℕ) : (c * a - b) / c = a - b / c := by
```
Same below (except for the iff lemmas)
Done.

This is an iff, so give as few explicit arguments as possible 
```suggestion
lemma eq_div_iff_mul_eq_left (hc : 0 < c) (hcb : c ∣ b) : a = b / c ↔ b = a * c := by
```
Same below
Done

```suggestion
    Nat.mul_div_right _ (zero_lt_of_ne_zero <| Nat.mul_ne_zero hb hd)]
```
a bit shorter

```suggestion
protected lemma div_mul_right_comm (hba : b ∣ a) (c : ℕ) : (a / b) * c = (a * c) / b := by
```
since this lemma right-commutes multiplication and division, and since there could be a corresponding lemma in the root namespace. Also the brackets are unnecessary
```suggestion
protected lemma div_mul_right_comm (hba : b ∣ a) (c : ℕ) : a / b * c = a * c / b := by
```
Could you please also add `Nat.mul_div_right_comm` (which is just `(Nat.div_mul_right_comm ..).symm`)?

Sure.

One questtion: why the `protected` tag?

pullRequest.title: feat: add rewriting lemmas about naturals

source.title: feat (Tactic): add unify_denoms and collect_signs tactics
